Article Title: Bangladesh unrest: Acted mute to save myself - Indian Tabla player recalls trauma
Article Text:
Representative image

Yunus Govt Takes Responsibility Of Dipu Das Family After India Erupts Over Hindu Man's Lynching

KOLKATA: Tabla player Mainak Biswas and photographer Kallab Ghosh, who accompanied Sarod player Shiraz Ali Khan for his December 19 concert at Chhayanaut in Bangladesh, found themselves in a precarious situation in Dhaka after the event was cancelled.Recounting 48 hours of intense anxiety they endured before finally managing to return home on December 22, Biswas said he had never felt so vulnerable in the neighbouring country, which he has earlier visited at least five times. He said he had always received warmth from the people of Bangladesh.“However, this visit turned into my worst nightmare. I could never have imagined how difficult life could become as a Hindu trapped in Bangladesh when anti-Indian rhetoric was at its peak,” said Biswas after his return to Kolkata.The tension, he said, was suffocating, and every moment was spent in anticipation of what could go wrong. “It is easy to identify me as an Indian. Hence, the fear of being targeted was ever-present. The ordeal is a constant reminder of the vulnerability.”“My mother and grandmother were at home in Kolkata. But I didn’t call them up to share my tension. I still feel a shiver down my spine when I recall those helpless hours,” Biswas recounted.“I had switched off my phone. My mind went blank when I learned what had happened to Dipu Das. I couldn’t fathom what might await me if a mob attacked me.”The situation became increasingly challenging after Shiraz’s departure. “He had reputation of a renowned musician and the advantage of a Khan surname. Unlike him, I couldn’t even speak local dialect. They say those who can’t speak have no enemies. I decided to remain silent and pretend I couldn’t speak. Shiraz’s mother was with us, and I had the added responsibility of ensuring her safety,” Biswas said.
Article Summary: Tabla player Mainak Biswas and photographer Kallab Ghosh found themselves in a precarious situation in Dhaka after the event was cancelled. Biswas said he had never felt so vulnerable in the neighbouring country, which he has earlier visited at least five times.

Article Title: Randi Mahomes steps up with a holiday giveaway to support families raising young athletes amid Patrick Mahomes' devastating injury
Article Text:
The Kansas City Chiefs are navigating a difficult season, and quarterback Patrick Mahomes is sidelined with a significant injury. Amid this challenging time, Patrick Mahomes' mother, Randi Mahomes, is focusing on a different mission which is to support families raising young athletes.

How Randi Mahomes is turning her experience into support for sports parents

The Mahomes family is creating a powerful off-field narrative even though the Kansas City Chiefs are struggling on the field. Randi Mahomes is opting to do something that is very personal to her this holiday season after her son Patrick Mahomes got injured.She is reaching out to families to help support families with young athletes. Through The Sports Parent Academy, Randi Mahomes announced a giveaway of 200 full courses aimed at helping parents guide young athletes.Randi is providing 200 full courses of her Sports Parent Academy which is an online platform aimed at assisting parents in establishing their children through all levels of youth athletics. She based her discussion on her own experience raising three children, one who is an NFL superstar, and thus gave the initiative as a service to others in difficult moments.“It’s here!!! With everything happening in our world and in our family, one thing that never changes is wanting to pour into others and give back where we can,” Randi wrote. “That’s why this giveaway means so much to me. I’m excited to be giving away Sports Parent Academy courses and hope they can be a blessing to your family!”The Sports Parent Academy, which was launched earlier this year, was constructed on the lessons that Randi claims to have learned the hard way.She also stated that she “wished [she] had while raising [her] 3 kids through all the wins, losses, and everything in between.”The program is not just another sports advice show. It provides mindset training, communication advice, Q&A, and information on how to create balance between encouragement and realism. Senior employees such as psychologist and performance coach Dr. Elizabeth Lombardo will make sure that the advice is realistic and accurate.To Randi, this is an initiative that mirrors a thought of how more educated and confident parents are able to develop healthier athletic lives.Also Read: Brittany Mahomes stays silent as Randi Mahomes steps up with a message of hope during Patrick Mahomes’ recovery

Now, two games into the 2025 season, he has amassed over 397 passing yards, three touchdowns, and a passer rating of 86.6.Rivers’ drive as a quarterback remains strong on the gridiron. What about his mode of transportation? What about his car collection? Two vehicles reportedly fill his garage: a 2008 Ford F-150 [some reports say F-250] and a Cadillac Escalade SUV. The customized SUV costs about $200,000, while his everyday Ford’s estimated cost is not publicly disclosed. Let’s take a closer look at them.Francisco Cruz of Ford Authority reported in April 2020, that despite earning $215 million as an NFL quarterback, Philip Rivers is driving a 2008 Ford F-150 pickup truck. Rivers drives a heavy-duty truck that is almost 17 years old now. The multi-millionaire star’s primary vehicle boasts a towing capacity over 9,000 pounds and has a 5.4L Triton V8 engine with 300 horsepower and 365 pound-feet of torque.It can easily carry six people. Higher-end model features include powered and heated leather seating, dual-zone automatic climate control, entertainment options such as a CD or DVD system, a large center console, and folding rear seats for cargo flexibility. In September 2017, Kevin Acee of the San Deigo Union-Tribune reported that Rivers’ primary mode of transportation is a 2008 Ford F-250.The second vehicle to catch attention is a Cadillac Escalade SUV. Rivers contacted the makers of high-end vehicles for Hollywood elites like Dr. Dre, Stevie Wonder Jerry Seinfeld , and Barbra Streisand . Reportedly costing close to $200,000, the SUV was customized by Becker Automotive Design in Oxnard, California, in 2017. Amenities include a 40-inch TV, refrigerator, two captain seats with Rivers’ No. 17 on one headrest, satellite TV, wireless internet, a fresh-air ventilation system, a professional quality sound system, and electric leg extensions.Rivers spoke about the SUV with the San Diego Union-Tribune in 2017. “My two biggest things were my family time and my preparation and what I owe this football team,” Rivers said. “I was not going to sacrifice either of them in any big proportion. I can look at all the pluses and minuses and say, ‘Okay, this does it.’This allows me to get home in six to seven hours, which is when I got home the last 11 years, and it allows me to watch all or more of the film I watched before. I don’t want it to be - he’s stuck in a car all day, maybe that’s why he struggled.” The father of ten may be currently using this Cadillac Escalade to prepare for Colts’ matchups.According to Spotrac, Rivers’ career earnings total $244.2 million as of December 2025. He signed a one-year, $1.255 million contract with the Indianapolis Colts for the 2025 season. His estimated net worth in 2025 is reportedly $100 million.Also Read: Kay Adams wants to take away Philip Rivers’ Hall of Fame and give it to Shaun Alexander—for having 14 children

As speculation grows around Travis Kelce’s future in the NFL, an emotional message from longtime teammate Chris Jones has added fresh weight to the conversation. With the Kansas City Chiefs preparing to host the Denver Broncos, what could be Kelce’s final home game at Arrowhead Stadium has suddenly taken on deeper meaning.Ahead of Thursday night’s matchup, Jones spoke candidly about the possibility that Kelce may be playing his last game in front of the Arrowhead faithful. His words reflected both respect and uncertainty.“It’s sad… I hope it isn’t his last ride, but if it is, I tip my hat off to him. Hell of a career,” Jones said, acknowledging the gravity of the moment.The message resonated across the fanbase, especially given the Chiefs’ disappointing campaign that saw them fall out of playoff contention. For many, Jones’ remarks felt like a quiet acknowledgment that the Kelce era in Kansas City could be nearing its end.Kelce, now deep into a career that has redefined the tight end position, has remained non-committal about his future. The Chiefs’ struggles this season have only intensified retirement talk, particularly with the franchise entering an uncertain transition phase.Head coach Andy Reid did little to shut down the speculation when asked about Kelce’s status, though his praise for the veteran was unmistakable.“I don’t know if it is. I haven’t talked to him,” Reid said. “But his numbers, his personality, the person - I think speaks for themselves. Phenomenal person. Great for the community. He’s everything you want from a player representing an organization.”Those comments, while supportive, stopped short of offering clarity, leaving fans to read between the lines.Whether or not Kelce chooses to walk away after this season, his impact on the Chiefs is undeniable. From redefining the offense to serving as a locker-room leader, Kelce has been central to Kansas City’s modern identity. For teammates like Jones, the thought of seeing him step away is both emotional and inevitable.The Broncos game, now framed by nostalgia and uncertainty, could serve as a symbolic farewell, or simply another chapter in a storied career that isn’t quite ready to close.For now, Kelce’s focus remains on the field. But as Arrowhead prepares to roar one more time this season, Jones’ message has ensured that whatever happens next, Kelce’s legacy is already secure.

Article Title: 5 Best NBA Christmas games of all time

How Joel Embiid’s Supermax Hits the 76ers’ Salary Cap

This contract paved the way for Embiid’s 2017 “supermax” rookie contract worth $148 million.Philadelphia’s intentions are clear about Joel Embiid: they want to keep this elite talent at home.Currently, Joel Embiid is under a 4-year $213 million veteran extension contract with the 76ers in 2012 that gives him an annual salary of $55.2 million for the 2025-26 season while carrying a cap hit of $55 million.This contract will keep at Philadelphia through the 2026-27.In September 2024, the 2023 MVP reportedly, signed a three-year maximum extension worth $193 million with a player option keeping him home through 2028-29. This extension solidified Joel's legendary status as the franchise's pillar and appreciated his loyalty and commitment towards 76ers. Along this because of the new extension, Joel Embiid’s annual salary will jump up to a staggering $62.7 million for the 2026-27 season, pushing his career earnings to a projected total over $500 million by the end of the 2028 season, which is currently at $321 million.Through this deal, Embiid is ready to enter the exclusive club, joining legends like LeBron James and Stephen Curry as the only players to surpass $500 million in career earnings, showcasing how an exceptional talents needs an exceptional contract.The next hurdle that teams in the league are facing post awarding their players with astronomical contracts, is the NBA’s luxury tax. The threshold for this season is $187.8 million, with more penalties and restrictions for any offenders.Philly’s total salary for this season is estimated at around $194.9 million, incurring a $7.3 million in luxury tax. Embiid’s deal consumes a significant amount of the team's total cap space, leaving a thin margin, and with the league’s stricter rules, the franchise has limited flexibility in free agency. Article Title: Watch: Cyclist Mathieu van der Poel shows his racing class, wins in Hofstade despite vape smoking incident by a spectator near finish

Wearing his racing glasses, he appeared calm and crossed the line first despite the distraction.Even with the interruption, Mathieu van der Poel finished 48 seconds ahead of Wout van Aert. It’s simply inappropriate and improper… It’s a shame that something so small gets so much attention. All the riders were very positive; this is a fantastic course… That’s much more important to take home than an action like this. ”Unfortunately, this was not an isolated incident for Van der Poel. In recent years, he has faced repeated crowd interference. Spectators have thrown beer and allegedly urine at him during cyclo-cross and road races. At Paris-Roubaix in April 2025, a spectator threw a full water bottle into his face. He was also spat at during the E3 Saxo Classic and had a cap thrown into his wheels at the 2024 Paris-Roubaix.After the Hofstade race, Van der Poel downplayed the vape smoke incident.“I saw it too, but I don’t know if it was on purpose. The fallout from DK Metcalf’s sideline altercation with a fan has continued to ripple across the NFL, and one of the most direct responses has now come from inside the Pittsburgh locker room. Veteran player Cam Heyward did not mince words while addressing the two-game suspension handed to DK Metcalf, offering a message that was equal parts understanding and firm accountability.The incident occurred during the Steelers’ Week 16 win over the Detroit Lions, when Metcalf was caught on camera engaging in a heated exchange with a fan seated near the sideline. While officials missed the moment in real time, the league did not. After reviewing the footage, the NFL suspended Metcalf without pay for violating its strict policy against players entering the stands or making physical contact with fans.Speaking on his Not Just Football podcast, Heyward acknowledged the reality players face from the stands but stressed that certain boundaries can never be crossed.“Fans say some crazy stuff,” Heyward said. “I’ve heard a lot over the years. But you never put your hands on anybody.”The longtime Steelers captain revealed that most players on the sideline were unaware of what had transpired until after the game. Even so, Heyward was clear that while verbal abuse can take an emotional toll, physical retaliation is never an option in today’s NFL.“You don’t want to be treated like a caged animal,” he added. “But there’s a responsibility that comes with the platform we have.”The controversy has been further complicated by differing versions of events. A source close to Metcalf claimed the fan used racial slurs and made derogatory comments about the wide receiver’s family. The fan, however, has denied those allegations through legal representation.Regardless of what was said, the league’s stance was decisive. Metcalf will forfeit more than $555,000 in salary due to the suspension, and reports suggest the incident could also impact future guarantees tied to his contract. While the Pittsburgh Steelers have publicly backed Metcalf, the financial and reputational stakes are significant.Heyward stopped short of excusing his teammate but also redirected part of the conversation toward fan conduct. He emphasized that respect must work both ways.“There’s responsibility as a fan too,” Heyward said. “We don’t talk about people’s families. We don’t talk about them as individuals.”It was a measured stance from one of the league’s most respected voices, acknowledging the pressures players face while reinforcing that professionalism must prevail.As Metcalf prepares to serve his suspension and the Steelers adjust their plans without one of their top offensive weapons, Heyward’s message stands out for its clarity. In a league increasingly scrutinized for player-fan interactions, his words underscored a simple truth: emotions may run high, but crossing that line comes at a steep cost.

Veteran player Cam Heyward addressed the incident on his Not Just Football podcast. Heyward acknowledged the reality players face from the stands but stressed that certain boundaries can never be crossed.
